title: Youngest shark attack victim not expected to survive injuries
description: The youngest shark attack victim in New South Wales' recent spate of attacks is now not expected to survive his injuries. #sharkattack #shark #vaucluse #sydneyharbour #sharkbeach

title: National day of mourning observed across Australia
description: Australians will observe a national Day of Mourning today to remember the victims of the Bondi terror attack. Flags on government buildings will be flown at half mast and there will be a minuteâ€™s silence at 7.01pm this evening. #bondi #mourning #victims #bondibeach #dayofmourning

title: Sydney's shark crisis sparks drone safety push | 7NEWS
description: Sydney faces an unprecedented shark emergency following four attacks in 48 hours, with bull sharks remaining close to shore heading into the long weekend. Marine life ranger Sharky Baxter advocates for automated drone-in-a-box technology costing $20,000-$30,000 that could patrol beaches from 6am to 6pm without human operators. A 200-kilogram male bull shark was caught off Camp Cove Beach in Sydney Harbour, highlighting the proximity of these predators to popular swimming areas. title: Louis Tomlinson's journey to happiness with new album | 7NEWS
description: Louis Tomlinson releases his new solo album 'How Did I Get Here?' in 2026, marking 15 years since his career began with One Direction in 2011. The album represents a shift towards happiness and self-acceptance following personal losses, including the death of bandmate Liam Payne and earlier losses of his mother and sister. Tomlinson discusses fatherhood, his upcoming tour including Australian dates, and finding his authentic artistic identity beyond his One Direction roots. title: National day of mourning for Bondi terror victims | 7NEWS
description: Australia observes a national day of mourning for the 15 victims of the December 14 Bondi terror attack. Flags fly at half-mast, landmarks will be illuminated, and Australians are encouraged to light candles at 7:01pm in solidarity with the Jewish community. NSW Premier Chris Minns discusses community safety measures, new hate and gun law reforms, and the recent shark attacks in NSW waters, including the critical injury of 12-year-old Nico Antic. title: All Nationals MPs quit frontbench
description: All shadow ministers from the National Party have resigned from the front bench en masse after a schism with the Liberals over hate crime laws, leaving the coalition teetering on the brink of its second break-up in eight months. #auspol #nationals #liberals #coalition #frontbench

title: Trump says he won't use force to take Greenland
description: President Donald Trump says a future deal is possible regarding his plans for the control of Greenland.   Following his speech at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland, Trump wrote on Truth Social that he had a â€œvery productive meetingâ€ with the Secretary General of NATO, Mark Rutte.   He said the pair formed â€œthe framework of a future dealâ€ concerning Greenland as well as the â€œentire Arctic Regionâ€. #trump #nato #greenland #europe #tariff

title: Black Hawk retrieves flood-swept cars from Great Ocean Road | 7NEWS
description: A Blackhawk helicopter is conducting a complex salvage operation along Victoria's Great Ocean Road, retrieving 12 to 14 cars that were swept into the ocean during flooding at Cumberland River in Lorne a week ago. The vehicles, belonging to campers at Cumberland River Caravan Park, have been battered by waves and rocks for seven days, with some potentially submerged further out to sea. The operation involves closing the Great Ocean Road for several hours while SES divers attach harnesses to the damaged vehicles, which are then airlifted back to the caravan park by a private contractor pilot working within the helicopter's four-tonne weight limit. title: Nationals leader says Coalition 'untenable' under Sussan Ley
description: Nationals leader David Littleproud has said the Coalition is "done" after Liberal leader Sussan Ley refused to reinstate three Nationals senators to the frontbench after they voted against the government's proposed hate speech laws. #coalition #auspol #nationals #liberals #auspol

title: 'It's like being in a washing machine': Divers battle surf to salvage 15 cars swept into ocean|7NEWS
description: A black hawk helicopter is being used to recover 15 flood-damaged cars swept into the ocean along Victoria's Great Ocean Road. Salvage divers are working in challenging surf conditions to sling vehicles that travelled down a riverbed before ending up on rocks and in the sea. The vehicles, belonging to campers at Cumberland River Caravan Park are expected to be write-offs due to extensive water, sand and rock damage. title: $200 million of upgrades for NSW public schools over summer
description: More than $200 million has been spent on upgrades at hundreds of public schools in NSW over the summer. #school #education #upgrade #nsw #nswpol

title: K'gari death sparks dingo management debate | 7NEWS
description: A 19-year-old Canadian tourist, Piper James, has died on K'gari (Fraser Island) in Queensland, with autopsy results pending to determine whether she drowned or was attacked by dingoes. The incident has sparked debate about whether dingoes should be culled or tourist access restricted, with Fraser Coast Mayor George Seymour advocating for banning young children from camping in unfenced areas rather than culling the native animals. Dingo attacks have increased in severity and frequency over the past four to five years, primarily targeting children aged eight and under.
